intro: Corothamnus, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. These shrubs are native to the western United States and are characterized by their bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The leaves are typically small, narrow, and arranged in pairs along the stems. Corothamnus species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid conditions. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wildlife.
